column4: ok. lshw and sysinfo didn't work. I'll be more specific--I'm trying to see if my soundcard is working. How can I do this?
It's a soundblaster
cat /proc/asound/cards
Trying that now.
I did what you said but I'm not sure what I'm looking at.
you should be looking at a list of the soundcards in your computer
so if there's one there, then it looks like your soundcard is working
Doesn't that also show the internal soundcard?
yeah it should show the internal sound card too, unless you've disabled it in your bios config
Can you please look at http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/20421/ and tell me if my Sound Blaster is working?
which sound blaster is it?
The only info I have is a booklet. Do you mean 16 PCI
it's a Soundblaster 16 PCI?
cool ;-). I have an ISA one of them somewhere.
I think the SiS card is your soundblaster
Ok good--so it should be working then right?
yep
Then I don't know what to do because I don't get any sound at all from my computer.
are you still around?
yep
would you mind helping me to try and get my sound up and running?
hm. In that case you should direct your questions to #fedora ... I haven't used Fedora for years and anyway this channel is for help with Ubuntu.
I agree with mneptok, install Ubuntu :-)
